title: account sharing clarification
body:
hey i know this might sound super simple but i was just asking for some clarification on account sharing

1) are you allowed to sell your account to someone else whereby they are the only one using it and you cease to use it?
2) how do you know if someone is account sharing?
3) if someone is banned, how do you know they arent using a smurf?

thanks

replies.body:
> are you allowed to sell your account to someone else whereby they are the only one using it and you cease to use it?

No. Account sales, trading, gifting or sharing, in any form, is strictly prohibited by the TOU and EULA. Any account found to be violating this will be banned (though, Riot seems to be a bit more lenient in cases where people are sharing with others they live with).

> how do you know if someone is account sharing?

Probably the only way would be to look for variations in their match history. This includes champions used, binding of summoner spells (do they have flash on D or F?), statistics (K/D/A, CS, wards placed etc), item builds etc.

> if someone is banned, how do you know they arent using a smurf?

As players, we don't. Riot (apparently) has some reliable systems when it comes to identifying smurf accounts, though. That said, there's never been any rule against the use of smurfs, even by players who've had accounts banned previously (if I'm not mistaken. This seems to be a bit of an oversight by Riot, they should be considering history of all accounts where possible). The issue with smurfs is not that they exist, but how they're used.

>As players, we don't. Riot (apparently) has some reliable systems when it comes to identifying smurf accounts

No they don't, all they have is IP bans up their sleeves and outside of sitting on someone's stream if they are a twitch streamer, it can easily be bypassed just by not streaming.

> 1) are you allowed to sell your account to someone else whereby they are the only one using it and you cease to use it?

No. 

> 2) how do you know if someone is account sharing?

Many things, although Riot doesn't disclose exactly how for the same reason they don't tell players which programs got them 3rd party cheat banned.  

Some things are pretty obvious from looking at match history, for example a sudden change in champ pool, changing key binds all the time, locations account is accessed from jumping (especially from different cities/countries), both attempting to access the account at the same time. 

>3) if someone is banned, how do you know they arent using a smurf?

Please elaborate on this one. 
Do you mean if they are banned for toxicity that they don't just change to a smurf and continue playing or something else? Its usually pretty obvious when its someone using a smurf/account sharing, usually the locations of the smurf and the main stay the same.

1) No

2) Multiple factors, ranging from IP, location, blah blah blah

3) Riot do know, they'll occasionally ban smurfs along side the main account depending on how severe the original case is.

the problem arises then is if you play league on a public connection, like at university between lectures or if you use multiple computers to play league, like tablet at uni and desktop at home. Or when you have siblings playing league (who may or may not be better than you are, even though you introduced them to the game {{item:3070}} )

-

Also what is riot's stance on a smurf, simply for playing normals when you don't feel like playing with your mates and you don't want them to know to you are playing solo because sometimes they get super toxic or pick on you for being silver. 

I mean you don't want to unfriend them because they'll know, but sometimes you just want to relax and play league on your own with allchat muted.
As long as you aren't intentionally ruining your MMR to play with lesser skilled players, smurfs are fine.

well I mean I'm a midsilver (i feel bronze) support/fill main... so I'm not sure it'd matter if I even tried to do that. he only reason I got the rank I did, was I simply played whatever champion could best complete the teamcomp, warded and didn't feed.

I can't  'outplay' on my current setup and so I modified my playstyle to suit that. I get 200ms (internet at home got alot worse recently for unknown reasons), 10fps (this drops massively during teamfights), touchscreen 9inch tablet (not a laptop, I installed windows os on it though) and I use a wireless usb keyboard and mouse (might see about getting a usb adapter and using wired though since I hear those are a bit more reliable).

Riot's official stance on smurfs is that there's nothing wrong with using them, it's *how* they're used that's the issue. Basically, as long as you follow the rules, Riot don't care how many accounts you use.

Believe it or not you actually do not own "your" lol account. There for you can not sell it because it's not yours to actually sell.

Riot owns your account and anything to do with your account. Any money you spend on said account does not make it any more your account. 

Realistically and this is really stupid riot can ban your account simply because they left like it on the day. You have no ownership over your account what so ever.

Basically you dump a shit tone of money into a LoL account that riot has said they will let you use until they decide not to let you use it any more.

The lua you agree to when making your account basically states that if you take the time to read it.
